You are overweight! Even being slightly overweight increases your risk of developing cancer, cardiovascular disease and type 2 diabetes. Talk to your doctor about ways you can lose weight.

You weigh too much! Obesity increases the risk of cardiovascular disease due to the build-up of excess fat in the blood vessels, which can lead to heart attacks, strokes, etc. Don\'t underestimate this condition!

You weigh way too much! Think about changing your eating habits and getting treatment under the supervision of an appropriate specialist. Remember that every kilogram you lose, you regain your health!
Being seriously underweight can weaken your immune system and also increase your risk of osteoporosis and other serious illnesses.
You weigh far too little! Starvation is a significant loss of muscle and fat tissue, posing a threat to health and life.

You weigh far too little! Body wasting (cachexia) is characterized by a significant decrease in body weight associated with the loss of subcutaneous tissue and loss of muscle mass. Be sure to talk to your doctor!
